text: is it possible to make contact with a
ghost by staring into the mirror well
there is a strong superstitious
tradition which links mirrors with death
when someone in the family dies you
cover the mirrors and it's to prevent
the newly deceased soul from being able
to come back and become part of anyone
else who was passing by the mirror that
catches the clips of themselves in it
this mirror
mysticism has found expression in a
gruesome tale a legend of Bloody Mary
like all the best ghost stories bloody
mary is a frightful morality tale this
one cautioning against the sin of vanity
you see Mary worth knew she was a
champagne truffle in the chocolate box
of life 18 years old she was bright
beautiful and completely self-absorbed
and the focus of her vanity was a lovely
wavy hair every night before she went to
bed she would brush her golden locks
exactly 100 times the story goes that
she was so busy manipulating her mop
that she didn't notice a man concealed
in her closet
in fact she didn't even clock him when
he crept up behind her calm down calm
down he didn't kill her he just wanted
to cut her hair
unfortunately patience wasn't one of
Mary's virtues she couldn't bear the
idea of waiting for her Mane to grow
back so she decided to end it all
a hairy end for Mary but there's more
people say that if you light a candle at
midnight stare in the mirror brush your
hair and repeat three times merely worth
Mary worth Mary worth are you there
she'll be after more than just your hair
of course it's all just a bit of fluff
to scare the bejesus out of ourselves
but as nuts as this sounds there may
just be a kernel of truth in the idea of
mirrors being used to contact another
dimension in terms of physics there are
all these possibilities that there are
multiple parallel universes existing
alongside our own which go back maybe to
two people like Lewis Carroll when he
wrote some Alice in Wonderland Alice
Through the Looking Glass now Lewis
Carroll was a mathematician and he had
ideas about the possibility that there's
another space-time another universe on
the other side of this mirror now it's
not a real physical mirror but the fact
that there's a border a barrier of
Stargate between our universe and
another one so it's not so crazy
